ygData.subject: RE: Powerleveling bards (was Cazic Thule Slain....]
ygData.msgSnippet: Ok, well I missed the previous posts to this... just got back from vacation to 300 EQ Bards email...so I hope you ll forgive me for just deleting them :-)
ygData.messageBody:
Ok, well I missed the previous posts to this... just got
back from vacation to 300 EQ Bards email...so I hope you'll forgive me for
just deleting them :-)

Anyway, speaking as a shaman ... you bet its tough and you
better not chuckle or no buffs for you! I think the most difficult part is
people not understanding that when you're playing healer, you don't have
mana to slow, quick, malise, buff, and heal like a cleric. But I still love
it :-)
We'll see if I like the Bard better once I level her up a
bit, she's pretty fun right now too.

And man, Togor's does rock :-)

Happy New Year!

Halana, 43rd Shaman
Tani, 17th Bard
And a new little monkette
Solusek Ro

-----Original Message-----
From: Ryan Honeyman
[mailto:honeyman@...]
Sent: Wednesday, January 05, 2000 9:49 AM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Powerleveling
bards (was Cazic Thule Slain....]

> Might add shaman to this list, they have a
lot of different
> spells, and deciding when to cast which
isn't the easiest.

I most definitely do not envy their job.
So many spells, so
little mana. And everyone has got to have
X buff, beg beg beg.
It would drive me nuts.

> I still chuckle to myself as I watch
shamans spend half the fight
> trying to slow the target, at which time
the wizard stands up and
> finishes it off in 10 seconds.

Togors is incredible if it sticks. I
mean, wow... thing is
barely moving. hehe.

Harmonic.
